changes.original_content:
[QUOTE="Xaldarin, post: 461117, member: 242440"]
When I try to use the "/mac kissassist manual" command self targeted on my tank, he will not buff himself.  If I run it the same but without the manual designation, he buffs himself fine.  I was under the impressions that the manual command would allow me to control him but would still handle basics and buffs. Is there some other config I need to do to get this to work?

Appreciate any feedback.
[/QUOTE]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/#manual-mode-everything-off[/URL]

you need to "turn on" what different things you want to work

[quote]
[B]Manual mode[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=29']edit[/URL]][/B]
/mac kissassist manual - starts kissassist with everything turned off. 
You may then use In Game Commands to turns certain things on, such as /buffson, /healson, /dpson, etc.

[/quote]
changes.new_content:
[QUOTE="Xaldarin, post: 461117, member: 242440"]
When I try to use the "/mac kissassist manual" command self targeted on my tank, he will not buff himself.  If I run it the same but without the manual designation, he buffs himself fine.  I was under the impressions that the manual command would allow me to control him but would still handle basics and buffs. Is there some other config I need to do to get this to work?

Appreciate any feedback.
[/QUOTE]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/#manual-mode-everything-off[/URL]

you need to "turn on" what different things you want to work

[quote]
[B]Manual mode[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/B]
/mac kissassist manual - starts kissassist with everything turned off. 
You may then use In Game Commands to turns certain things on, such as /buffson, /healson, /dpson, etc.

[/quote]

changes.original_content:
[CODE lang="ini" highlight="4"]/if (${Math.Distance[${CampYLoc},${CampXLoc}]} > ${CampRadiusExceed} && !${Role.Find[hunter]} && ${ReturnToCamp}==1 && ${CampZone}==${Zone.ID}) {
    DEBUGMOVE DoWeMove:(ReturnToCamp) CampRadiusExceed turning off ReturnToCamp.
    /varset ReturnToCamp 0
    /echo Leashing exceeded distance of ${CampRadiusExceed} turning off ReturnToCamp
    /return
}[/CODE]

You're pulling stuff (using melee) from outside your camp and you're not flagged as a hunter perhaps?

I found this in the docs.


[SIZE=18px][B]Control movement in camp[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=44']edit[/URL]][/B][/SIZE]
The following settings and explanation only applies if UseMQ2Melee ini entry is turned [B]off[/B] and during [B]Combat[/B].

[LIST=1]
[*]To keep the MA/Tank from darting/jumping out to meet the mob. Set MeleeDistance and CampRadius to the same Value. This will tell Kiss to skip any /moveto commands.
[/LIST]
[B]By default, MeleeDistance is set to 75, so you may want to change that?[/B]
changes.new_content:
[CODE lang="ini" highlight="4"]/if (${Math.Distance[${CampYLoc},${CampXLoc}]} > ${CampRadiusExceed} && !${Role.Find[hunter]} && ${ReturnToCamp}==1 && ${CampZone}==${Zone.ID}) {
    DEBUGMOVE DoWeMove:(ReturnToCamp) CampRadiusExceed turning off ReturnToCamp.
    /varset ReturnToCamp 0
    /echo Leashing exceeded distance of ${CampRadiusExceed} turning off ReturnToCamp
    /return
}[/CODE]

You're pulling stuff (using melee) from outside your camp and you're not flagged as a hunter perhaps?

I found this in the docs.


[SIZE=18px][B]Control movement in camp[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/B][/SIZE]
The following settings and explanation only applies if UseMQ2Melee ini entry is turned [B]off[/B] and during [B]Combat[/B].

[LIST=1]
[*]To keep the MA/Tank from darting/jumping out to meet the mob. Set MeleeDistance and CampRadius to the same Value. This will tell Kiss to skip any /moveto commands.
[/LIST]
[B]By default, MeleeDistance is set to 75, so you may want to change that?[/B]

changes.original_content:
From the Kissassist Manual:

[B][QUOTE]/addignore[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=40']edit[/URL]][/QUOTE][/B][QUOTE]
Add ignore can be used to add Mob ID's to a list. In situation where the Mobs name won't work for ignoring mobs when pulling, you can tell the /addignore command to use the ID instead.

Usage Example: /addignore ${Target.ID} 1

This will tell kissassist to maintain a list of ID's in the variable named MobsToIgnoreByID. This list is dynamic and is reset every time kiss is started.[/QUOTE]


The good thing with this command is you can run it while playing - no need to edit any files as per Homie's suggestion.

Just type /addignore Sir_Orwell

You can use partial names etc to, and it will tell you in the MQChat window if it has found the mob and added it.
changes.new_content:
From the Kissassist Manual:

[B][QUOTE]/addignore[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/QUOTE][/B][QUOTE]
Add ignore can be used to add Mob ID's to a list. In situation where the Mobs name won't work for ignoring mobs when pulling, you can tell the /addignore command to use the ID instead.

Usage Example: /addignore ${Target.ID} 1

This will tell kissassist to maintain a list of ID's in the variable named MobsToIgnoreByID. This list is dynamic and is reset every time kiss is started.[/QUOTE]


The good thing with this command is you can run it while playing - no need to edit any files as per Homie's suggestion.

Just type /addignore Sir_Orwell

You can use partial names etc to, and it will tell you in the MQChat window if it has found the mob and added it.

changes.original_content:
HI Wacky,

The Kissassist Manual is right here:
[URL]https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/#general-settings[/URL]

[SIZE=18px][B][Buffs] Settings[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=11']edit[/URL]][/B][/SIZE]
KissAssist Buffing System - How it works:

[LIST]
[*]Any character using KissAssist now writes all current and blocked buffs to the kissassist_buffs.ini file. KissAssist scans this file and compares it with the buffs that are listed in the character's Buffs section of their ini file. If another character is missing a buff, and it stacks, they will cast it on that character.
[*]This addition works only with characters boxed on the same computer because it writes to a central ini file in the macro folder. The feature writes and scans every 60 seconds so there should not be any noticeable lag. The file is self cleaning so you won't end up with a 30 mb ini file.
[*]To allow other macros to work see the Extras section!
[*]To overcome the limitation of running all characters on the same computer. Use DanNetOn=1.
[/LIST]
[B]Syntax: BUFF1=Spell/AA/Item|OptionalTypeOfBuffMod|Flag/Modifier/Target[/B] -- See below for examples.

[B][Buffs][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH][TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH][TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH][TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]BuffsOn[/B][/TD][TD]0[/TD][TD]0/1[/TD][TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles the buff feature.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]BuffsSize[/B][/TD][TD]20[/TD][TD][/TD]
[TD]Sets the number of Buff# to parse. Similar function to DPSSize. (Speculation: if BuffsSize=10, then Buff11, Buff12, etc. will be ignored.)[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]Buffs1-20[/B][/TD][TD]NULL[/TD][TD][B]Spell/AA/Item[/B][/TD]
[TD]What to buff.
[B]MA, !MA, Me, Melee, Caster, Class[/B] are valid targets flags.
Kiss automatically detects self-only buffs, but single target and group buffs can apply the [B]Me[/B] tag if you only want them cast on you. The [B]MA[/B] flag also works out of group.
The Class tag requires an additional paramater, and must follow the Class tag. Use with single target spells only.
[B]Examples:[/B]
Buffs3=Flameshield of Ro (This will cast on everyone)
Buffs3=Flameshield of Ro|MA (This will only cast on MA)
Buffs3=Flameshield of Ro|CLASS|WAR,SK,PAL (This will only cast on Warrior, Shadow Knight, or Paladin)
[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]RebuffOn[/B][/TD][TD]1[/TD][TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles rebuffing from spell worn off message.
If turned on and the caster get the worn off message then the caster will drop the buff from them self. This causes them to [B]Rebuff.[/B][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]CheckBuffsTimer[/B][/TD][TD][/TD]
[TD][/TD]
[TD]Number in seconds to skip checking buffs/rebuffing[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PowerSource[/B][/TD][TD]NULL[/TD][TD][/TD]
[TD]Specify the name of the PowerSource you want to maintain being equipped and active in your PowerSource inventory slot, as well as destroy/remove used powersources. You can maintain the PowerSource by treating it as a summoned item. (See Summon Items modifier below).[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
changes.new_content:
HI Wacky,

The Kissassist Manual is right here:
[URL]https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/#general-settings[/URL]

[SIZE=18px][B][Buffs] Settings[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/B][/SIZE]
KissAssist Buffing System - How it works:

[LIST]
[*]Any character using KissAssist now writes all current and blocked buffs to the kissassist_buffs.ini file. KissAssist scans this file and compares it with the buffs that are listed in the character's Buffs section of their ini file. If another character is missing a buff, and it stacks, they will cast it on that character.
[*]This addition works only with characters boxed on the same computer because it writes to a central ini file in the macro folder. The feature writes and scans every 60 seconds so there should not be any noticeable lag. The file is self cleaning so you won't end up with a 30 mb ini file.
[*]To allow other macros to work see the Extras section!

[/LIST]
[B]Syntax: BUFF1=Spell/AA/Item|OptionalTypeOfBuffMod|Flag/Modifier/Target[/B] -- See below for examples.

[B][Buffs][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH][TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH][TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH][TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]BuffsOn[/B][/TD][TD]0[/TD][TD]0/1[/TD][TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles the buff feature.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]BuffsSize[/B][/TD][TD]20[/TD][TD][/TD]
[TD]Sets the number of Buff# to parse. Similar function to DPSSize. (Speculation: if BuffsSize=10, then Buff11, Buff12, etc. will be ignored.)[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]Buffs1-20[/B][/TD][TD]NULL[/TD][TD][B]Spell/AA/Item[/B][/TD]
[TD]What to buff.
[B]MA, !MA, Me, Melee, Caster, Class[/B] are valid targets flags.
Kiss automatically detects self-only buffs, but single target and group buffs can apply the [B]Me[/B] tag if you only want them cast on you. The [B]MA[/B] flag also works out of group.
The Class tag requires an additional paramater, and must follow the Class tag. Use with single target spells only.
[B]Examples:[/B]
Buffs3=Flameshield of Ro (This will cast on everyone)
Buffs3=Flameshield of Ro|MA (This will only cast on MA)
Buffs3=Flameshield of Ro|CLASS|WAR,SK,PAL (This will only cast on Warrior, Shadow Knight, or Paladin)
[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]RebuffOn[/B][/TD][TD]1[/TD][TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles rebuffing from spell worn off message.
If turned on and the caster get the worn off message then the caster will drop the buff from them self. This causes them to [B]Rebuff.[/B][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]CheckBuffsTimer[/B][/TD][TD][/TD]
[TD][/TD]
[TD]Number in seconds to skip checking buffs/rebuffing[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PowerSource[/B][/TD][TD]NULL[/TD][TD][/TD]
[TD]Specify the name of the PowerSource you want to maintain being equipped and active in your PowerSource inventory slot, as well as destroy/remove used powersources. You can maintain the PowerSource by treating it as a summoned item. (See Summon Items modifier below).[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

changes.original_content:
[Pull]
PullRoleToggle=0/1 
PullWith=Distant Strike ;What you pull with
PullMeleeStick=0 ;
MaxRadius=1000
MaxZRange=250
UseWayPointZ=0
PullWait=30
ChainPull=0
ChainPullHP=40
PullPause=30|2|cond18
PullLevel=100|123
PullArcWidth=360
PullRadiusToUse=80
PullRoleToggle=0
PullOnReturn=0
[PullAdvanced]
PullLocsOn=0

Cond18=${Group.AnyoneMissing}
[B][Pull][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullWith[/B][/TD]
[TD]Melee[/TD]

[TD]Melee/AA/Pet/Spell /Disc/Ranged|Ammo[/TD]

[TD]Melee - will attack the mob to pull.
Pet - will pull with pet. Does not require LOS.
AA/Spell/Disc - will cast on the mob to pull.
RangedItem|AmmoItem - Must define 2 arguments. Item to pull with and Ammo slot item. (Separated by |)
[B]Examples:[/B]
PullWith=Dragon Force
PullWith=Summoned: Shuriken of Quellious|Summoned: Shuriken of Quellious
PullWith=Extravagant Infused Recurve Bow|Ethereal Arrow
PullWith=Pet

See PullRadiusToUse for more information on controlling distance from mob puller will stop and try to pull.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]MaxRadius[/B][/TD]
[TD]350[/TD]
[TD]Any #[/TD]
[TD]Radius in which you want to pull. [B]([URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/img-kissradius.jpg']visual[/URL])[/B][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]MaxZRange[/B][/TD]
[TD]50[/TD]
[TD]Any #[/TD]
[TD]Z Axis Radius in which you want to pull. Default =50 for hilly zones try 100-200. [B]([URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/img-kissradius.jpg']visual[/URL])[/B][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullWait[/B][/TD]
[TD]5[/TD]
[TD]Any #[/TD]
[TD]Time in seconds to wait looking for mobs if no spawns are up (you killed everything). Used mostly for camping named so you are aren't looking for mobs every second.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullRoleToggle[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles puller tag in group window before pulls and turns it off once back in camp after a pull. You must be group leader to do this. Used to keep healer merc in camp during pulls. [B](Currently only active in PullerPetTank role)[/B][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullTwistOn[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]Bard Only - will turn off twisting before pulling if set to 0.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]ChainPull[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles chain pulling. Chain pulling [I]ONLY[/I] works in the Puller role, not PullerTank.[B]++[/B][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]ChainPullHP[/B][/TD]
[TD]90[/TD]
[TD]1-100[/TD]
[TD]Mob HP level to start looking for another mob to pull[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullPause[/B][/TD]
[TD]2[/TD]
[TD]#Minutes[/TD]

[TD]Time in Minutes to pull mobs before Holding Pulls|How long in minutes after holding to resume pulls. [B]Optional[/B] Cond# can be used to check if pulls should continue to be held.
Pulls will be held if condition returns true. [B]Example:[/B]
PullPause=30|2|cond1
cond1=${Me.Snared}
[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullLevel[/B][/TD]

[TD]0|0[/TD]

[TD]0-200|0-200[/TD]

[TD]MinLevel|MaxLevel - 10|20 would set lowest level of mobs to pull to 10 and highest level to 20.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullMeleeStick[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]Use this flag to stick to target when pulling with melee. Helps with mobs that are moving.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]UseWayPointZ[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD][B]Only used with Advanced Path[/B]. This feature will use the paths waypoint, not the Pullers, when checking mobs MaxZRange.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullRadiusToUse[/B][/TD]
[TD]90[/TD]
[TD]1-100[/TD]
[TD]The percentage, of the items range you want to use when determining when to stop and pull a mob. Basically you can use this to determine how close you want to get to mobs when pulling.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullArcWidth[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0-360[/TD]
[TD]The width in degrees on the compass. See /setpullarc in the command section.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullOnReturn[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]If the puller fails to pull current target. Then on the way back to camp, the puller will search for another mob to pull.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[TD][/TD]

[TD]++ See Advanced Options[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
[HEADING=2][PullAdvanced] Settings[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=22']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[B][PullAdvanced][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]PullLocsOn[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]Turn on or off using the PullLocs areas in the KissAssist_Info.ini file for the zone. For more information see the KissAssist_info.ini Setup Instructions.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]Turn on or off using the PullLocs areas in the KissAssist_Info.ini file for the zone. For more information see the KissAssist_info.ini Setup Instructions.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

DPS2=Slowing Helix|99|

DPS1=edict of tashan|99|tash
DPS2=slowing helix|99|slow



as for the getting aggro thru walls - thats the AE punt/AE tash- easy way to fix that is dont use it - you should be fine without it -

[HEADING=3][/HEADING]
[HEADING=3]DebuffAllOn[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=12']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
You can apply the debuffall tag specifically to spells you want to cast debuffs on all mobs in camp. Spells without this tag will revert to the default Kiss debuffing style.

[LIST]
[*]Syntax: DPS1=Spell/AA|MobHealth%|debuffall|slow/tash/malo/crip/snare/strip|always -- See below for examples.
[LIST]
[*]When setting up the order of your debuffs. If you are going to use a combination of Spells and AA's. It's a good idea to stagger them, where an AA follows a Spell. The reason for this is that AA's can be cast while spells are still in a global cool down.
[*]Currently, in MQ2 there is no way to test if a debuff spell will overwrite/stack/land on the mob before you cast it. Also there is no easy way to determine if spell is a slow, tash, malo, crip, snare type spell. So it is required that users specify this tag for the debuff type, if it applies.
[/LIST]
[/LIST]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD][B]DebuffAllOn=0[/B][/TD]
[TD]OFF. Kiss casts debuffs normally, debuffing only the primary kill target assigned by the MA. It is advised when turning off DebuffAllOn, that you set [B]DPSOn=2[/B] for better results.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]DebuffAllOn=1[/B][/TD]
[TD]This will try and cast every buff, but will not wait for spells/AAs to become ready. If spell is ready, cast it. If spell is not ready move on to next spell/AA. rinse and repeat. After best try casting on current mob. Move on to next mob. This behavior will continue until all debuffs have been cast on all mobs. This option is considered best try and gives priority to DPS than Debuffing. Take into consideration that after trying to debuff each mob if you are a caster with DPSOn set up, That the DPS routine will be run on the MA's current target between each mob being checked for debuffs.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]DebuffAllOn=2[/B][/TD]
[TD]This option will spend more time trying to make sure all debuffs are cast on each mob. This option is considered persistent and gives priority to Debuffing than DPS. There is an exception. If you have a debuff that has a long recast timer, that debuff may be skipped.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
[B]Slow/tash/malo/crip tag[/B] - is used to check mob for the current TYPE of debuff, and the "always" tag is used to know if to overwrite the current TYPE debuff.

[B]Strip tag[/B] - is used for dispelling beneficial buffs from mobs.

[B]Always tag[/B] - Be careful when using the always tag, because this could cause your character to spam that debuff, if your spell will not overwrite an existing debuff already on the mob.

[B]Examples:[/B]
Shaman:

DPS1=Regenerating Counterbias|99|debuffall|slow|always
DPS2=Malosenia|98|debuffall|malo
Mage:

DPS1=Malosenia|99|debuffall|malo|always
Enchanter:

DPS1=Enunciation of Tashan|99|debuffall|tash|always
DPS2=Dreary Deeds|98|debuffall|slow
DPS3=Demolished Consciousness|97|debuffall|crip

changes.original_content:
for WAR aggro on multipulls
you can set this up in AE settings -


[HEADING=2][AE] Settings[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=26']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
Area effect settings for spells & abilities

[B][AE][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AEOn[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles AE on and off.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AESize[/B][/TD]
[TD]10[/TD]
[TD][/TD]

[TD]Number of AE ini entries. Similar to DPSSize.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AERadius[/B][/TD]
[TD]50[/TD]
[TD]Any #[/TD]
[TD]Radius around character to detect mobs.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AE1-10[/B][/TD]
[TD]NULL[/TD]
[TD][B]Spell/AA/Disc/Item|Min#Mobs|TargetFlag[/B][/TD]
[TD]What to cast|Min Number of mobs in radius to activate|TargetFlag - [B]Mob, MA, Me, Pet, Single[/B] are valid targets flags. [B]Example:[/B] AE1=Explosion of Spite|2|Mob
[B]Single[/B] - Use an AE ability if there is [I]only 1[/I] mob in camp. [B]Example:[/B] AE1=Rain of Jerikor|1|single
Note: Using the [B]Single[/B] tag will also override the check for aggroing additional mobs in AE range. So use with caution.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

AEOn=1
AESize=8
AERadius=50
AE1=Wade Into Battle|3
AE2=Warlord's Fury|3
AE3=Area Taunt|3
AE4=Projection of Fury|1
AE5=Warlord's Tenacity|3
AE6=Warlord's Fury|3
AE7=Roar of Challenge|1
AE8=Confluent Expanse|3

changes.original_content:
Set CastingInterruptOn=0.

If you still want this function for DPS spells or others you can follow the instructions from the KA wiki:

[QUOTE]
[HEADING=2]CastingInterruptOn[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=34']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
You can now determine What interrupt(s) you want checked. Using 1 in the INI file turns on all Interrupts by defaulting CastingInterruptOn=30.
Each Interrupt check has been given a value:
Buffs = 2, Heals = 4, DPS = 8, and Mez = 16
By doing this you are now able to control any of the interrupts you want turned on.
To turn on more than one interrupt simply add the values together.
Example:
To Interrupt Mezzing(16) and DPS(8) set CastingInterruptOn=24
To Interrupt Buffing(2) and Heals(4) set CastingInterruptOn=6
To Interrupt Just Mezzing(16) set CastingInterruptOn=16
[/QUOTE]
changes.new_content:
Set CastingInterruptOn=0.

If you still want this function for DPS spells or others you can follow the instructions from the KA wiki:

[QUOTE]
[HEADING=2]CastingInterruptOn[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
You can now determine What interrupt(s) you want checked. Using 1 in the INI file turns on all Interrupts by defaulting CastingInterruptOn=30.
Each Interrupt check has been given a value:
Buffs = 2, Heals = 4, DPS = 8, and Mez = 16
By doing this you are now able to control any of the interrupts you want turned on.
To turn on more than one interrupt simply add the values together.
Example:
To Interrupt Mezzing(16) and DPS(8) set CastingInterruptOn=24
To Interrupt Buffing(2) and Heals(4) set CastingInterruptOn=6
To Interrupt Just Mezzing(16) set CastingInterruptOn=16
[/QUOTE]

changes.original_content:
[USER=237992]@Trapper[/USER] - That is working beautifully,  that pulse is what everyone needs to see... its awesome on a busy map.  

What is broken is the bad examples in the wiki:
[QUOTE]
[HEADING=1]Examples[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/macroquest/plugins/core-plugins/map/mapfilter/&action=edit&section=2']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Make named spawns appear as large triangles
[/LIST]
/mapfilter named triangle 8

[LIST]
[*]shows player pets within 800
[/LIST]
/mapfilter custom pcpet radius 800

[LIST]
[*]turn off custom filters
[/LIST]
/mapfilter custom
[/QUOTE]

changes.original_content:
My Ini is set to /DPSon 2,  but if I read this correctly - manual MODE starts with everything off.   So I am in a bit of double jeopardy, as you stated ctaylor22 starting macro with dpson=0 (aka off) will not create the timers,  yet manual mode does exactly that.



[QUOTE]

[HEADING=1]Miscellaneous[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=30']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[HEADING=3]Manual mode[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=31']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/cmd-mackissassist/']/mac kissassist manual[/URL] - starts kissassist with everything turned off. You may then use In Game Commands to turns certain things on, such as /buffson, /healson, /dpson, etc.
[/QUOTE]
changes.new_content:
My Ini is set to /DPSon 2,  but if I read this correctly - manual MODE starts with everything off.   So I am in a bit of double jeopardy, as you stated ctaylor22 starting macro with dpson=0 (aka off) will not create the timers,  yet manual mode does exactly that.



[QUOTE]

[HEADING=1]Miscellaneous[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[HEADING=3]Manual mode[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/cmd-mackissassist/']/mac kissassist manual[/URL] - starts kissassist with everything turned off. You may then use In Game Commands to turns certain things on, such as /buffson, /healson, /dpson, etc.
[/QUOTE]

changes.original_content:
You can also use the Aggro section to tell your character(s) to do things to help loose aggro.

[HEADING=2][Aggro] Settings[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=27']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]

[B][Aggro][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AggroOn[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles aggro boosting or lowering mechanics settings.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AggroSize[/B][/TD]
[TD]5?[/TD]
[TD]#[/TD]
[TD]Number of Aggro# entries to parse. Similar to DPSSize.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]Aggro1-5[/B][/TD]
[TD]Null[/TD]

[TD][B]AA/Disc/Item/Spell|% aggro|>/</<<|TargetFlag|Cond[/B][/TD]

[TD]Aggro1=WhatToDo|PctAggroToDoIt|<,<<,>|TargetFlag|Cond

AA/Disc/Item/Spell|% aggro|<,>,<< less than/greater than/double less than| Me/MA/Pet/Mob(Default) cast on Target.
use < to increase or maintain aggro
use > to decrease or avoid aggro
use << to check secondary aggro
Targetflag defaults to the targeted mob if left empty, or null. You may also use targetflag INC for incoming mobs, those further away than MeleeDistance. Targetflag Me, MA, and Pet are also accepted.
Aggro also evaluates Conditions.
[B]Examples (Gain Aggro):[/B]
Aggro1=Taunt|100|<
Aggro2=Terror of Kra`Du|100|<

[B]Examples (Drop Aggro):[/B]
Aggro1=Sanctuary|80|>
Aggro2=Divine Peace|95|>

[B]Examples (Secondary Aggro):[/B]
Aggro1=MobsHateThis|50|<<

This will use MobsHateThis if targets secondary aggro gets above 50
If TargetFlag is not provided it is defaulted to Mob.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
changes.new_content:
You can also use the Aggro section to tell your character(s) to do things to help loose aggro.

[HEADING=2][Aggro] Settings[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]

[B][Aggro][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AggroOn[/B][/TD]
[TD]0[/TD]
[TD]0/1[/TD]
[TD]0=Off/1=On - Toggles aggro boosting or lowering mechanics settings.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AggroSize[/B][/TD]
[TD]5?[/TD]
[TD]#[/TD]
[TD]Number of Aggro# entries to parse. Similar to DPSSize.[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]Aggro1-5[/B][/TD]
[TD]Null[/TD]

[TD][B]AA/Disc/Item/Spell|% aggro|>/</<<|TargetFlag|Cond[/B][/TD]

[TD]Aggro1=WhatToDo|PctAggroToDoIt|<,<<,>|TargetFlag|Cond

AA/Disc/Item/Spell|% aggro|<,>,<< less than/greater than/double less than| Me/MA/Pet/Mob(Default) cast on Target.
use < to increase or maintain aggro
use > to decrease or avoid aggro
use << to check secondary aggro
Targetflag defaults to the targeted mob if left empty, or null. You may also use targetflag INC for incoming mobs, those further away than MeleeDistance. Targetflag Me, MA, and Pet are also accepted.
Aggro also evaluates Conditions.
[B]Examples (Gain Aggro):[/B]
Aggro1=Taunt|100|<
Aggro2=Terror of Kra`Du|100|<

[B]Examples (Drop Aggro):[/B]
Aggro1=Sanctuary|80|>
Aggro2=Divine Peace|95|>

[B]Examples (Secondary Aggro):[/B]
Aggro1=MobsHateThis|50|<<

This will use MobsHateThis if targets secondary aggro gets above 50
If TargetFlag is not provided it is defaulted to Mob.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

changes.original_content:
What class are you pulling with?
Try pulling with something other than melee

Also I think you gonna have to change the mage melee assist to something lower as well

[HEADING=2]Melee] Settings[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/kissassist/&action=edit&section=10']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[B][Melee][/B]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH][I][B]Settings[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Default[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]Values/Mods[/B][/I][/TH]
[TH][I][B]What this setting does[/B][/I][/TH]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][B]AssistAt[/B][/TD]
[TD]95[/TD]
[TD]1-100[/TD]
[TD]Mob health to assist/attack. This affects when you engage and is NOT specific to melee characters. IE pet classes will send pets at this %.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

changes.original_content:
[QUOTE="BlueBug, post: 647088, member: 246341"]
Re-reading through the post I found this -

[CODE]/noparse /dgge /docommand /timed ${Math.Rand[20,80]} /say[/CODE]


I'm wondering if this creates a random delay for EACH toon that is using the Mimic or does it create a single random delay and all the other toons mimic /say at the same time? If that is the case is there a way to make the random /say different for each toon?

And curious whats the difference, if any, between the command /timed and /delay in the above line.


Thanks guys,

BB~
[/QUOTE]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/macroquest/reference/commands/delay/[/URL]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH]Syntax[/TH]
[TD]/delay <#>[s | m] [<condition to end early>][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TH]Description[/TH]
[TD]When used in a macro, fully pauses the macro for the amount of time specified, or until condition is met.
Time can be specified in 10ths of a second (a number by itself) or in seconds (number followed by an "s") or minutes (number followed by "m").[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]


[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/macroquest/reference/commands/timed/[/URL]
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TH]Syntax[/TH]
[TD]/timed <#> <command>[/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TH]Description[/TH]
[TD]Executes command after a specified duration, given in deciseconds.[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
[HEADING=3]Notes[[URL='https://www.redguides.com/docs/projects/macroquest/reference/commands/timed/&action=edit&section=3']edit[/URL]][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]This does not pause successive commands.
[/LIST]



Delay is stop until something happens (just stops your script not necessarily other MQ things.

Timed is do this after this time, while doing other things.
